intro: Nemcia tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-toothed nemcia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having a distinct, sharp tooth at the tip. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and they bloom in clusters. Nemcia tricuspidata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
